p: While a and b are thought to be constant, we know that δ 13C atm and C a are changing rapidly. This could result in a corresponding change in Δ leaf values as plants adapt to increased [CO 2] or subsequent regional climate changes, for example, systematic changes in local precipitation). Alternatively, Δ leaf values of leaves may stay constant but show marked changes in δ 13C leaf values corresponding to changes in δ 13C atm values if leaves are incorporating δ 13C atm into leaf tissues at a rate unaffected by other climate conditions.
